# OSLogFloatFormatting

**Structure**

The formatting options for double and floating-point numbers.

## Declaration

```swift
@frozen struct OSLogFloatFormatting
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogFloatFormatting] structure encapsulates the formatting details for `double` and `float` values. Use the static [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogFloatFormatting/fixed], [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogFloatFormatting/hex], [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogFloatFormatting/exponential], and [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogFloatFormatting/hybrid] structures to apply default formatting for floating-point values. You can also create new [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogFloatFormatting] structures that customize the rules for handling a leading plus sign, precision information, and more.

## Getting the Standard Formats

- **fixed**: The standard fixed-point format option.
- **hex**: The standard hexadecimal format for floating-point values.
- **exponential**: The standard exponential format option.
- **hybrid**: A hybrid option that changes the format according to the size of the number.

## Creating a Custom Formatting Object

- **exponential(explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom exponential format with a system-determined precision value.
- **exponential(precision:explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom exponential format with the specified precision value.
- **fixed(explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom fixed-point format with a system-determined precision value.
- **fixed(precision:explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom fixed-point format with the specified precision value.
- **hex(explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom hexadecimal format.
- **hybrid(explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom hybrid format with a system-determined precision value.
- **hybrid(precision:explicitPositiveSign:uppercase:)**: Creates a custom hybrid format with the precision value.

## Value Formatters

- **OSLogBoolFormat**: The formatting options for Boolean values.
- **OSLogIntegerFormatting**: The formatting options for integer values.
- **OSLogInt32ExtendedFormat**: The formatting options for 32-bit integer values.
- **OSLogPointerFormat**: The formatting options for pointer data.
